In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Certainly! Below is a function definition in Julia that does what you described:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the column name
    lc_col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    strip_col = strip(lc_col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    clean_col = replace(strip_col, ' ' => '_')
    clean_col = replace(clean_col, '-') => '_'
    
    return clean_col
end
```

To use this function, simply pass a string representing the column name you want to clean:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```

This function will return the cleaned version of the column name as a string.
